thread.title: Tyne Valley Retail Park in Hexham bought by Arch for £7.39m
thread.title_full: Tyne Valley Retail Park in Hexham bought by Arch for £7.39m

author: Coreena Ford
title: Tyne Valley Retail Park in Hexham bought by Arch for £7.39m

locations.name: tyne valley retail park share tyne valley retail park

text:
Tyne Valley Retail Park in Hexham bought by Arch for £7.39m The Northumberland Council-backed company has bought a fully-let retail unit on Tyne Valley Retail Park Share Tyne Valley Retail Park (Photo: Cushman & Wakefield) Share Get business   Thank you for subscribing!   
Northumberland’s council-back development group Arch has added to its growing portfolio with a £7.39m deal to acquire part of a Hexham retail park. 
Acting on behalf of Arch Group, Cushman & Wakefield has acquired a 38,103 sq ft retail warehouse unit on Tyne Valley Retail Park in Hexham, Northumberland . 
The deal value reflects a yield of 6.61% for the vendors Network Rail, which was represented by Knight Frank. 
The modern warehouse, which was completed in 2014, is fully let to Poundstretcher, Pets at Home, Home Retail Group and Majestic Wine Warehouse. 
Richard Turner, senior director at Cushman & Wakefield, said: “Investment in the retail warehouse sector has remained resilient post Brexit, particularly for modern well let assets such as Tyne Valley Retail Park. 
“The park forms part of the core shopping offer for western Northumberland and we were impressed with the trading feedback from tenants. 
“We are delighted to have once again helped Arch grow their investment portfolio of prime assets in Northumberland.” Read More Newcastle housebuilder Bellway starts buying land again 
The purchase follows several significant developments at Ashington-based Arch: The North­­umberland Development Company. 
In November the group strengthened its property portfolio after exchanging contracts for the purchase of Westmorland Retail Park in Cramlington from Hammerson plc for £36m. 
That deal came four months after Arch bought the adjacent Manor Walks Shopping Centre from Hammerson for £78m, a complex the company said had huge potential for expansion, bringing a further boost to the local economy through improvements to its surrounding infrastructure. 
Coun Dave Ledger, chairman of Arch, said: “Tyne Valley Retail Park is an exciting new acquisition for Arch. 
“The park in Hexham provides a vast variety of amenities for local customers and we look forward to working with the businesses on the retail park to help boost the local and wider economy.” Like us on Facebook
